gurmukhi: ਅਗਸਤ ਪੁਲਸਤ ਬਸ਼ਿਸ਼ਟ ਤੇ ਅਾਦਿ ਨ ਜਾਨ ਪਰੇ ਕਿਹ ਦੇਸ ਪਠਾੲੇ ॥ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਚਲਾੲਿ ਬਨਾੲਿ ਮਹਾ ਮਤਿ ਫੇਰਿ ਮਿਲੇ ਪਰ ਫੇਰ ਨ ਅਾੲੇ ॥੪੯੭॥
transliteration: Agadt Pulast Bashisht Te Aadh Na Jaan Dare Kih Des Pathaae|| Mantra Chadhaae Banaae Mahaa Mat(i) Pher Mile Par Pher Na Aae||497||
translation: There had been many sages like Agastya, Pulastya, Vashistha etc., but it could not be known to which directions they have gone; they composed mantras and established many sects, but they merged in the cycle of dreadful existence, that after that nothing c

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮ ਨਿਰੰਧ੍ਰ ਕੋ ਫੋਰ ਮੁਨੀਸ਼ ਕੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਸੁ ਜੋਤਿ ਕੇ ਮੱਧਿ ਮਿਲਾਨੀ ॥ ਪ੍ਰੀਤ ਰਲੀ ਪਰਮੇਸ਼ਰ ਸੌ ੲਿਮ ਬੇਦਨ ਸੰਗਿ ਮਿਲੈ ਜਿਮ ਬਾਨੀ ॥
transliteration: Brahm Nirandhra Ko Phor Mounndesh Kijot(i) Su Jot(i) Ke Maddh(i) Milaanee|| Preet Raliparmeshar Su Im Bedan San(i) Milai Jim Baanee||
translation: Breaking the Brahmarandhra (an aperture in the crown of the head), the light of the king of sages merged in that Supreme Light; his love was absorbed in the Lord like all kinds of compositions are interlinked in the Veda;

gurmukhi: ਪੁੰਨ ਕਥਾ ਮੁਨਿ ਨੰਦਨ ਕੀ ਕਹਿ ਕੈ ਮੁਖ ਸੋ ਕਬਿ ਸਯਾਮ ਬਖਾਨੀ ॥ ਪੂਰਣ ਧਿਅਾੲਿ ਭਯੋ ਤਬ ਹੀ ਜਯ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਜਗਨਾਥ ਭਵੇਸ ਭਵਾਨੀ ॥੪੯੮॥
transliteration: Pounn Kathaa Mounndi) Nandan Kikah(i) Kai Moukh So Kabi Syaam Bakhaanee|| Pooran Dhiaae Bhayo Tab Hijaya Sri Jagnath Bhaves Bhavaanee||498||
translation: In his way, the poet Shyam has described the episode of the great sage Dutt; this Chapter is now being completed hailing the Lord of the world and the mother of the world.498.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕ ਗ੍ਰੰਥੇ ਦੱਤ ਮਹਾਤਮ ਰੁਦ੍ਵਤਾਰ ਪ੍ਰਬੰਧ ਸਮਾਪਤੰ ਸੁਭੰ ਭਵੇਤ ਗੁਰੂ ਚੳੁਬੀਸ ॥੨੪॥
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Datt Mahaatam Rudravataar Prabandh Samaaptan Soubhan Bhavet Guroo Chaoubees||24||
translation: End of the description of the composition regarding the sage Dutt, the incarnation of Rudra in Bachittar Natak.
The Lord is One and He can be attained through the Grace of the True Guru.

gurmukhi: ਅਥ ਪਾਰਸ ਨਾਥ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਕਥਨੰ ॥ ਪਾਤਿਸ਼ਾਹੀ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Ath Paaras Naath Rudra Avtaar Kahanan|| Paat(i)shaahi10||
translation: Now begins the description of Parasnath, the incarnation of Rudra. Tent Guru.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਬਿਧ ਦੱਤ ਰੁੱਦ੍ਰ ਅਵਤਾਰਾ ॥ ਪੂਰਣ ਮਤ ਕੋ ਕੀਨ ਪਸਾਰਾ ॥ ਅੰਤ ਜੋਤ ਸੋ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਿਲਾਨੀ ॥ ਜਿਹ ਬਿਧਿ ਸੋ ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਭਵਾਨੀ ॥੧॥
transliteration: Eh Bidh Datt Ruddra Avtaaraa|| Pooran Mat Ko Keen Pasaaraa|| Ant Jot So Jot(i) Milaanee|| Jih Bidh(i) So Paarbrahm Bhavaanee||1||
translation: In this way there was the Dutt incarnation of Rudra and he spread his religion; in the end, according to the Will of the Lord, his light (soul) merged in the Supreme Light of the Lord.1.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ਲੱਛ ਦਸ ਬਰਖ ਪ੍ਰਮਾਨਾ ॥ ਪਾਛੇ ਚਲਾ ਜੋਗ ਕੋ ਬਾਨਾ ॥ ਗਯਾਰਵ ਬਰਖ ਬਿਤੀਤਤ ਭਯੋ ॥ ਪਾਰਸ ਨਾਥ ਪੁਰਖ ਭੂਅ ਵਯੋ ॥੨॥
transliteration: Eh Lachchh Das Barakh Pramaanaa|| Paachhe Chalaa Jog Ko Baanaa|| Gyaarav Barakh Biteetat Bhayo|| Paaras Naath Purakh Bhooa Vayo||2||
translation: After that, the Yoga-marga (path) continued its way for one lakh and ten years; with the passing away of the eleventh year, Parasnath was born on this earth.2.

gurmukhi: ਰੋਹ ਦੇਸ ਸੁਭ ਤਿਨ ਭਲ ਥਾਨੂ ॥ ਪਾਰਸ ਨਾਥ ਭਯੋ ਸੁਰ ਗਯਾਨੂ ॥ ਅਮਿਤ ਤੇਜ ਅਸਿ ਅਵਰ ਨ ਹੋੳੂ ॥ ਚੱਕ੍ਰਤ ਰਹੇ ਮਾਤ ਪਿਤ ਦੋੳੂ ॥੩॥
transliteration: Roh Des Soubh Tin Bhal Thaanoo|| Paaras Naath Bhayo Sur Gyaanoo|| Amit Tej As(i) Avar Na Hooo|| Chakkrat Rahe Maat Pit Dooo||3||
translation: On an auspicious day and at an auspicious place and country, he was born; he was supremely learned and glorious; there was none so illustrious like him and seeing him, his parents were wonder-struck.3.

gurmukhi: ਦਸੳੂ ਦਿਸਨਿ ਤੇਜ ਅਤਿ ਬਢਾ ॥ ਦ੍ਵਾਦਸ ਭਾਨ ੲੇਕ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਚਢਾ ॥ ਦਹਦਿਸ ਲੋਕ ੳੁਠੇ ਅਕੁਲਾੲੀ ॥ ਭੂਪਤ ਤੀਰ ਪੁਕਾਰੇ ਜਾੲੀ ॥੪॥
transliteration: Das-oo Disan(i) Tej At(i) Badhaa|| Dvaadas Bhaan Ek Hvai Chadhaa|| Dahdis Lok Outhe Akulaaee|| Bhoopat Teer Poukdare Jaaee||4||
translation: His glory spread in all the ten directions and it seemed that the twelve suns were shining in one; the people in all the ten directions felt agitated and went to the king for their lamenation.4.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨੋ ਭੂਪ ੲਿਕ ਕਹੌ ਕਹਾਨੀ ॥ ੲੇਕ ਪੁਰਖ ੳੁਪਜਯੋ ਅਭਿਮਾਨੀ ॥ ਜਿਹ ਸਮ ਰੂਪ ਜਗਤ ਨਹੀ ਕੋੲੀ ॥ ੲੇਕੈ ਘੜਾ ਬਿਧਾਤਾ ਸੋੲੀ ॥੫॥
transliteration: Souno Bhoop Ik Kahau Kahaanee|| Ek Purakh Oupjyo Abhimaanee|| Jih Sam Roop Jagad Nahikoee|| Ekai Ghadaa Bidhaataa Soee||5||
translation: “O king! Listen, we tell you an episode; a very proud person has been born and there is none so beautiful like him; it seems that the Lord (Providence) Himself had created him.5.

gurmukhi: ਕੈ ਗੰਧ੍ਰਬ ਜੱਛ ਕੋੲੀ ਅਹਾ ॥ ਜਾਨੁਕ ਦੂਸਰ ਭਾਨ ਚੜ ਰਹਾ ॥ ਅਤਿ ਜੋਬਨ ਝਮਕਤ ਤਿਹਂ ਅੰਗਾ ॥ ਨਿਰਖਤ ਜਨ ਕੇ ਲਜਤ ਅਨੰਗਾ ॥੬॥
transliteration: Kai Gaddhrab Jachchh Koiahaa|| Jaanouk Doosar Bhaan Chad Rahaa|| At(i) Jaban Jhamkat Tihan Anad|| Nirkhat Jan Ke Lajat Ananad||6||
translation: “Either he is a Yaksha or Gandharva; it appears that a second sun has arisen; his body is gleaming with youth and seeing him, even the god of love is feeling shy.”6.
